p: Finally, contrary to popular belief, the intake of omega 6 fatty acids is quite low in Europe and in the USA [ 12, 13]. According to an INRAN-SCAI survey, in which omega 6s were unfortunately reported together with omega 3 polyunsaturates, the cumulative PUFAs intake in Italy covers only 4â€“5% of total calories [ 81]. In conclusion, an increase in omega 6 dietary intake from seed oils, vegetables, and nuts could help to further reduce coronary risk, especially in countries where consumption is sub-optimal [ 70].
